content.description: Luisa is a manager at a pet insurance company with many customers. Sixty percent of the company’s customers filed claims in the past year. Luisa will randomly select <math alttext="12 customers" overflow="scroll"> <mn>12</mn> </math> customers from all the company’s customers.
content.question: Assuming the customers selected are independent of each other, which of the following is closest to the probability that more than <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> of the <math alttext="12 customers" overflow="scroll"> <mn>12</mn> </math> customers sampled did not file claims in the past year?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
